item.title: “When life happens - a kid, a mortgage, a car - you lose festival visitors. But what we see know, is that they’re coming back. Sometimes even together with their kids."
item.description:

item.title: South Congress Avenue
item.description:
South Congress Avenue

We ride bicycles, because that's how we ride

item.title: The Associated Press (AP): an 170 year-old startup
item.description:
The Associated Press (AP): an 170 year-old startup 

The Associated Press’s executive editor Kathleen Carroll likes to call AP the world’s largest independent news organization. AP is independent because it doesn’t have shareholders, it isn’t funded by venture capitalists and it isn’t any part of a governmental organization. Speed and screen time are the most challenging aspects of providing accurate and credible coverage of news in the real-time news era. A startup mentality with digital bootcamps is core to increasing the speed and screen time of its coverage.

item.title: “Homepage. Even the word sounds old. Today the news lives where you live."
item.description:
“Homepage. Even the word sounds old. Today the news lives where you live." 

History repeats itself (but differently) 

Ben Lerer’s theory of media evolution: a change in technology leads to a change in consumer behavior and this creates massive opportunities for building large media and content companies.
